title: CBS News reporter’s source says there’s a major error in the whistleblower complaint
text:
Keep in mind here that we’re dealing with an unnamed source, but CBS News State Department and foreign affairs reporter Christina Ruffini is reporting that, according to a senior government official, Counselor of the United States Department of State Ulrich Brechbuhl was not on the phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, as the unclassified whistleblower complaint states.

Scoop: Senior Govt Official tells @CBSNews Counselor to the State Department Ulrich Brechbuhl was NOT on the @POTUS call with #Zelensky, as the whistle blower complaint states. — Christina Ruffini (@EenaRuffini) September 26, 2019

If true, it’s a major error and puts a big crack in the whistleblower’s credibility. Keep in mind that the whistleblower wasn’t on the call either and got all of his or herhttps://twitter.com/El__Bohemio/status/1177334829785989120 information second- or third-hand.

Is this implying that the leaker was fed bad intel or is the concocted story all BS? — Ed Oxbow (@Carmard) September 26, 2019

Oh look, the whistleblower complaint contained lies: https://t.co/UNOQNGvN6T — Ryan Saavedra (@RealSaavedra) September 26, 2019

Fraud whistleblower couldn't even get THIS DETAIL CORRECT. So much for MASSIVELY DETAILED. https://t.co/7eixGYByVf — RealTalK (@SmallAxe2016) September 26, 2019

Oh. Well, that doesn't seem right. Does that mean it's a lie? How can we believe any of these claims now? https://t.co/CrJbzABKBE — English Fox (@lonefoxgeezer) September 26, 2019

First direct pushback here against the accuracy of the memo (other than discrepancies between the readout & its description), but is anyone on the record on this? https://t.co/bkzHjj8s6H — Dan McLaughlin (@baseballcrank) September 26, 2019

Mike Rogers just said how the IC didn't really investigate the allegations, that the Democrats are too confident. https://t.co/gMKujKNV6j — Langdale.ca (@laangled) September 26, 2019

If you're going to the mat on accusing the President of an impeachable offense, you damn well better not make one single slip up. https://t.co/sFu61lY5np — J.J. by the Bay (@flagg_colonel) September 26, 2019

Uh oh…its falling apart already. https://t.co/1DwARmX1a9 — Chris M (@cmultrading) September 26, 2019

Reminder that the whistleblower did not hear the conversation, and their recollection was a recollection from someone else. That was the problem with treating the complaint as sacrosanct https://t.co/q870YGq1TX — Kevin Tierney (@CatholicSmark) September 26, 2019

Looks like Adam Schiff is a worse writer than Ben Rhodes, fellas, if you are going to do grand narratives, you need to get your characters straight! https://t.co/kLwMfEzqxj — JRB (@jrbflyersfan) September 26, 2019

well shit – looks like the "whistleblower" was *FED* bad intel ……….. https://t.co/kgwu7rfpgO — Federal Spy Guy (@FederalSpyGuy) September 26, 2019

its already falling apart, cupcake. This is now the second lie, the first one belongs to Schiff. https://t.co/JiWqTTbdxQ — Jerry Fletcher (@guntotingteabag) September 26, 2019

Cant even get the details right. But for sure he knows what happened on that call https://t.co/VkckCLsToB — SpiffTheSpaceMan (@SpiffDSpaceman) September 26, 2019

Is there such a thing as 4th hand knowledge? — Kevin Wells (@Luckydogguy) September 26, 2019

This is eerily reminiscent of the Steele dossier in which Michael Cohen was said to be in Prague when Cohen had never been to Prague. https://t.co/9kkTFmQs3s — Rising serpent (@rising_serpent) September 26, 2019

Another day, another anti-Trump story revealed as Fake News. https://t.co/xZhGe9Qyno — Billy Swagspeare (@bswagspeare) September 26, 2019

SEEMS KIND OF IMPORTANT https://t.co/UZksbd0SVM — Abraham Woodhull (@politiwars) September 26, 2019

https://t.co/S92DMxzxNa The name of the state department official in the complaint? That official wasn't one of the group listening in, unlike what the whistleblower claimed. This official was the ONE NAMED WHITE HOUSE OFFICIAL in the entire document, as I noted. Leak marker. — Kyle (@HNIJohnMiller) September 26, 2019

I am beginning to think this was to smoke out leakers… https://t.co/qhQCdVjeqQ — HSJC Sister🚁❌ (@Peaches_Sabrina) September 26, 2019

Need to ask this leaker if he wrote the whole complaint? This is very stinky indeed. — UKForUSA (@UKForUSA) September 26, 2019

So now that question becomes; who leaked the confidential call? These conversations are classified. Should be relatively easy to identify the leaker and prosecute them under the espionage act. — Ricky Moser (@truckinforu) September 26, 2019

Related:
description: Just how far removed from the actual phone call was the whistleblower to get this wrong?
